intro: Primula souliei subsp. legendrei, commonly known as the Legendre's primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of China. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white, often with a distinctive yellow throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, particularly for rock gardens and shaded borders.
